DOC.brief_summary: The goal of the study was to determine effectiveness of a telephone reminder to increase pneumococcal vaccination in a managed care population.
DOC.brief_title: Racial Disparities in Pneumococcal Vaccination in Managed Care
DOC.detailed_description: Patients randomized to the intervention arm received a telephone call from managed care nurses asking about their pneumococcal vaccination status and whether they would like to be vaccinated. We compared six month follow-up of pneumococcal vaccination in electronic medical records for the intervention versus control group. We tested the percent vaccinated in each randomization arm using chi-square tests for proportions.
DOC.criteria: recommended for pneumococcal vaccination according to age or medical comorbidity already known to have received pneumococcal vaccine
DOC.keyword: pneumococcal vaccination coverage with no disease or efficacy outcomes recorded
